gurmukhi: icMq krI hm sO mn mY n QI jwnq sXwm ieqI kir hY ] bru mo qij kY qum Awnih kau bcnw ieh Bwiq ky au`cir hY ]
transliteration: Chint Kariham Sau Man Mai Na Thijaanat Syaam Itikar(i) Hai|| Bar(u) Mo Taj(i) Kai Toum Aanah(i) Kau Bachnaa Eh Bhaat(i) Ke Ouchchar(i) Hai||
translation: “I have become anxious in my mind and I did not know that Krishna would act like this with me; he would say to me that I should leave him and marry someone else;

gurmukhi: hmro mrbo eI bnXo ieh TwN jIA hY nw Av`is AbY mir hY ] mirbo ju n jwq Bly sjnI Awpn piq so hiT kY jir hY ]2154]
transliteration: Hamro Marbo Ibanyo Eh Thaan Jeeo Hai Na Avass(i) Abai Mar(i) Hai|| Maribo Ju Na Jaat Bhale Sajniaapan Pat(i) So Hath(i) Kai Jar(i) Hai||2154||
translation: It is necessary that I should die now and I shall die at this very place and if the dying is not appropriate, then with my persistence on my husband, I shall burn myself in his separationn.”2154.

gurmukhi: qRIA kwnH so icMqq huie mn mY mirbo eI bnXo icq bIc ibcwrXo ] mo sMig ikau biRjnwQ AbY kib sXwm khY ktu bYn aucwrXo ]
transliteration: Treeaa Kaahn So Chintat Hue Man Mai Maribo Ibanyo Chit Beech Bichdaryo|| Mo San(i) Kio Brijnaath Abai Kabi Syaam Kahai Kat(u) Hain Ouchdaryo||
translation: Getting angry with Krishna, Rukmani thought of only death because Krishna had spoken to her such-like bitter words;

gurmukhi: kRoD so Kwie qvwr Drw pr JUm igrI nhI nYk sMBwrXo ] XoN aupmw aupjI jIA mY jn tUt gXo ruK bXwr ko mwrXo ]2155]
transliteration: Krodh So Khaae Tavaar Dharaa Par Jhoom Girinahinaik Sanbhdaryo|| Yon Oupmaa Oupjijeea Mai Jan Toot Gado Roukh Byaar Ko Mdaryo||2155||
translation: In her rage, she being confounded fell down upon the earth and it appeared that with the slapping of the wind, the tree had broken and fallen down.2155.

gurmukhi: AMk lIXo Br kwnH iqh dUr krn ko kRoD ] swvDwn kr rukmnI jdupiq kIXo pRboD ]2156]
transliteration: Ank Leeyo Bhar Kaahn Tih Door Karan Ko Krodh|| Saavdhaan Kar Roukmanijadoupat(i) Keeyo Prabodh||2156||
translation: In order to remove her anger, Krishna took Rukmani in his embrace and loving her said like this;2156.

gurmukhi: qyry hI Drm qy mY suin suMdr kysn qy gih kMs pCwrXo ] qyry hI Drm qy isMD jrwhU ko sYn sBY iCn mwih sMGwrXo ]
transliteration: Dere Hidharam Te Mai Soun(i) Soundar Kesan Te Gadh Kans Pachhdaryo|| Dere Hidharam Te Sindh Jaraahoo Ko Sain Sabhai Chhin Maah(i) Sanhdaryo||
translation: “O beautiful woman! For your sake, I caught Kansa by his hair and knocked him down; I killed Jarasandh in an instant;

gurmukhi: qyry hI Drm ijqXo mGvw Aru qyry hI Drm BUmwsur mwrXo ] qoso kIXo auphws AbY muih qY Apny jIA swc ibcwrXo ]2157]
transliteration: Dere Hidharam Jityo Maghvaa Ar(u) Dere Hidharam Bhoomaasur Maarryo|| Toso Keeyo Oup-haas Abai Muh(i) Tai Apne Jeea Saach Bichdaryo||2157||
translation: I conquered Indra and destroyed Bhumasra; I just cut a joke with you, but you considered it a reality.”2157.

gurmukhi: XoN pIA kI qRIAw bwq sunI duKu kI qb bwq sBY ibsrweI ] BUl prI pRB kIjY iCmwN muih nwr invwr kY nwr sunweI ]
transliteration: Yon Peea Kitreeaa Baat Sounidoukh(u) Kitab Baat Sabhai Bisraaee|| Bhool Pariprabh Keejai Chhimaan Muh(i) Naar Nivaar Kai Naar Sounaaee||
translation: Hearing the words of the beloved, Rukmani forgot all her affliction; she said with bowed head, “O Lord! I had been mistaken; kindly forgive me;”

gurmukhi: Aaur krI aupmw pRB kI ju kib`qn mY brnI nhI jweI ] aUqr dyq BeI his kY hir mY auphws kI bwq n pweI ]2158]
transliteration: Aur Karioupmaa Prabh Kiju Kabittan Mai Barninahijaaee|| Ootar Det Bhaihas(i) Kai Har(i) Mai Oup-haas Kibaat Na Paaee||2158||
translation: The praises of the Lord that she uttered, cannot be described; she said, “O Lord ! I did not understand your pleasantry.”2158.
